intro: Brodiaea howellii, commonly known as Howell's brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, ovoid bulbs that serve as storage organs for nutrients. Brodiaea howellii is often found in coastal and inland areas, preferring full sun to partial shade.
